page.title: 17MANOR HOUSES IN UPHAM
page.content: UPHAM HOUSE Upham House is the most central of three large houses standing in a commanding position at the point where the mediaeval road left Upham to descend to Waltham.The estate was passed down from generation to generation until 1921, when it was broken up and the farms of Newlyn, Bigpath and Ower sold. WINTERSHILL HALL It is believed that a community of Jutes first worked Wintershill on a three-fold system of cultivation before the Norman Conquest. In 1464 there were about 300 acres of land, much of which was used for hunting.When King John went on a hunt there it lasted 27 days,and the King was accompanied by his greyhound keeper with war horses, brachet hounds, greyhounds and terriers.
